intro: Tetrapterys adenoloma, commonly known as the red-stemmed acanthus, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves with five to seven lobes and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in terminal clusters. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in coastal areas and riverbanks. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for horticultural cultivation in warm climates.
